name: Create a check run

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the check (e.g., "code-coverage").

params.name: head_branch
params.description: The name of the branch to perform a check against.

params.name: head_sha
params.description: The SHA of the commit.

params.name: details_url
params.description: The URL of the integrator's site that has the full details of the check.

params.name: external_id
params.description: A reference for the run on the integrator's system.

params.name: status
params.description: The current status. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: started_at
params.description: The time that the check run began in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: conclusion
params.description: **Required if you provide a `status` of `completed`**. The final conclusion of the check. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, or `action_required`. When the conclusion is `action_required`, additional details should be provided on the site specified by `details_url`.

params.name: completed_at
params.description: **Required if you provide `conclusion`**. The time the check completed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: output
params.description: Check runs can accept a variety of data in the `output` object, including a `title` and `summary` and can optionally provide descriptive details about the run. See the [`output` object](#output-object) description.

params.name: output.title
params.description: The title of the check run.

params.name: output.summary
params.description: The summary of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.

params.name: output.text
params.description: The details of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.

params.name: output.annotations
params.description: Adds information from your analysis to specific lines of code. Annotations are visible in GitHub's pull request UI. For details about annotations in the UI, see "[About status checks](https://help.github.com/articles/about-status-checks#checks)". See the [`annotations` object](#annotations-object) description for details about how to use this parameter.

params.name: output.annotations[].filename
params.description: The name of the file to add an annotation to.

params.name: output.annotations[].blob_href
params.description: The file's full blob URL.

params.name: output.annotations[].start_line
params.description: The start line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].end_line
params.description: The end line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].warning_level
params.description: The warning level of the annotation. Can be one of `notice`, `warning`, or `failure`.

params.name: output.annotations[].message
params.description: A short description of the feedback for these lines of code. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.annotations[].title
params.description: The title that represents the annotation. The maximum size is 255 characters.

params.name: output.annotations[].raw_details
params.description: Details about this annotation. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.images
params.description: Adds images to the output displayed in the GitHub pull request UI. See the [`images` object](#images-object) description for details.

params.name: output.images[].alt
params.description: The alternative text for the image.

params.name: output.images[].image_url
params.description: The full URL of the image.

params.name: output.images[].caption
params.description: A short image description.

description: Creates a new check run for a specific commit in a repository. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:write` permission to create check runs.

name: Update a check run

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the check (e.g., "code-coverage").

params.name: details_url
params.description: The URL of the integrator's site that has the full details of the check.

params.name: external_id
params.description: A reference for the run on the integrator's system.

params.name: started_at
params.description: A timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: status
params.description: The current status. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: conclusion
params.description: **Required if you provide a `status` of `completed`**. The final conclusion of the check. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, or `action_required`. When the conclusion is `action_required`, additional details should be provided on the site specified by `details_url`.

params.name: completed_at
params.description: **Required if you provide `conclusion`**. The time the check completed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: output
params.description: Check runs can accept a variety of data in the `output` object, including a `title` and `summary` and can optionally provide descriptive details about the run. See the [`output` object](#output-object-1) description.

params.name: output.title
params.description: **Required**.

params.name: output.summary
params.description: Can contain Markdown.

params.name: output.text
params.description: Can contain Markdown.

params.name: output.annotations
params.description: Adds information from your analysis to specific lines of code. Annotations are visible in GitHub's pull request UI. For details about annotations in the UI, see "[About status checks](https://help.github.com/articles/about-status-checks#checks)". See the [`annotations` object](#annotations-object-1) description for details.

params.name: output.annotations[].filename
params.description: The name of the file to add an annotation to.

params.name: output.annotations[].blob_href
params.description: The file's full blob URL.

params.name: output.annotations[].start_line
params.description: The start line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].end_line
params.description: The end line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].warning_level
params.description: The warning level of the annotation. Can be one of `notice`, `warning`, or `failure`.

params.name: output.annotations[].message
params.description: A short description of the feedback for these lines of code. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.annotations[].title
params.description: The title that represents the annotation. The maximum size is 255 characters.

params.name: output.annotations[].raw_details
params.description: Details about this annotation. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.images
params.description: Adds images to the output displayed in the GitHub pull request UI. See the [`images` object](#annotations-object-1) description for details.

params.name: output.images[].alt
params.description: The alternative text for the image.

params.name: output.images[].image_url
params.description: The full URL of the image.

params.name: output.images[].caption
params.description: A short image description.

description: Updates a check run for a specific commit in a repository. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:write` permission to edit check runs.

name: List check runs for a specific ref

params.name: ref
params.description: Can be a SHA, branch name, or tag name.

params.name: check_name
params.description: Returns check runs with the specified `name`.

params.name: status
params.description: Returns check runs with the specified `status`. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: filter
params.description: Filters check runs by their `completed_at` timestamp. Can be one of `latest` (returning the most recent check runs) or `all`.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: Lists check runs for a SHA, branch name, or tag name. To list check runs, your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository.

name: List check runs in a check suite

params.name: check_name
params.description: Returns check runs with the specified `name`.

params.name: status
params.description: Returns check runs with the specified `status`. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: filter
params.description: Filters check runs by their `completed_at` timestamp. Can be one of `latest` (returning the most recent check runs) or `all`.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: Lists check runs for a check suite using its `id`. To list check runs, your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository.

name: Get a single check run
description: Gets a single check run using its `id`. To get a check run, your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository.

name: List annotations for a check run

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: Lists annotations for a check run using the annotation `id`. To list annotations for a check run, your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository.

name: Get a single check suite
description: Gets a single check suite using its `id`. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository to get check suites.

name: List check suites for a specific ref

params.name: ref
params.description: The `ref` can be a SHA, branch name, or a tag name.

params.name: app_id
params.description: Filters check suites by GitHub App `id`.

params.name: check_name
params.description: Filters checks suites by the name of the [check run](https://developer.github.com/v3/checks/runs/).

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: Lists the check suites that were created for a commit `ref`. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository to list check suites.

name: Set preferences for check suites on a repository

params.name: auto_trigger_checks
params.description: Enables or disables automatic creation of CheckSuite events upon pushes to the repository. Enabled by default. See the [`auto_trigger_checks` object](#auto_trigger_checks-object) description for details.

params.name: auto_trigger_checks[].app_id
params.description: The `id` of the GitHub App.

params.name: auto_trigger_checks[].setting
params.description: Set to `true` to enable automatic creation of CheckSuite events upon pushes to the repository, or `false` to disable them.

description: Changes the default automatic flow when creating check suites. By default, the CheckSuiteEvent is automatically created each time code is pushed to a repository. When you disable the automatic creation of check suites, you can manually [Create a check suite](https://developer.github.com/v3/checks/suites/#create-a-check-suite). You must have admin permissions in the repository to set preferences for check suites.

name: Create a check suite

params.name: head_sha
params.description: The sha of the head commit.

params.name: head_branch
params.description: The name of the head branch where the code changes are implemented.

description: By default, check suites are automatically created when you create a [check run](https://developer.github.com/v3/checks/runs/). You only need to use this endpoint for manually creating check suites when you've disabled automatic creation using "[Set preferences for check suites on a repository](https://developer.github.com/v3/checks/suites/#set-preferences-for-check-suites-on-a-repository)". Your GitHub App must have the `checks:write` permission to create check suites.

name: Request check suites

params.name: head_sha
params.description: **Required.** The sha of the head commit.

description: Triggers GitHub to create a new check suite, without pushing new code to a repository. To request a check suite, your GitHub App must have the `checks:read` permission on a private repository or pull access to a public repository.
